alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 4:34AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches in the past 6 to 12 hours. Additional heavy rainfall of one-half to three- quarters of an inch will be possible through daybreak. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Flooding is most likely along Mallard Creek at Pavilion Boulevard. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeast Charlotte, Harrisburg and University City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
